More Information about Death of Korean Draftees Discovered 
    Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- More information about the death of Koreans who were forcibly drafted by the Japanese imperialists in the past, has been discovered, according to the south Korean MBC on Jan. 14.
 The south Korean Committee for Probing the Truth about Damage Done to the Korean Draftees under the Japanese Imperialists' Occupation said that it obtained boxes of remains of those Koreans who died after being drafted to an airport project in Hokkaido, Japan, and photos showing a joint memorial service held for them, etc.    
 The committee also found out documents of a Japanese government office dealing with the fact that 68 dead Koreans were buried or cremated and a site of a cemetery for them, the report added.
